Any.description:
`Any` contains an arbitrary serialized message along with a
URL that describes the type of the serialized message

@type.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized message.

typesDataValue.title: A data value of one of the following type

permissionGroup.title:
permission group
(-- aip.dev/beta-blocker: refactor to use permission common resource when it's ready --)

v2ExpiringPermissionTimeUnit.description:
- EXPIRING_PERMISSION_TIME_UNIT_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified
 - EXPIRING_PERMISSION_TIME_UNIT_DAYS: Days
 - EXPIRING_PERMISSION_TIME_UNIT_WEEKS: Weeks
 - EXPIRING_PERMISSION_TIME_UNIT_MONTHS: Months
 - EXPIRING_PERMISSION_TIME_UNIT_FOREVER: Forever
v2ExpiringPermissionTimeUnit.title: Expiring Permission Time Unit enums

query.description: The query used to filter against Research Notes, such as keyword, custom fields, templates, etc.

pageSize.description:
The maximum number of research notes to return. The service may
return fewer than this value. If unspecified, at most 10
note will be returned.

pageToken.description:
A page token, received from a previous 'FilterResearchNotes' call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters provided to
'FilterResearchNotes' must match the call that provided the page
token.

v2FilterResearchNotesResponse.title:
The response message for ResearchAPI.ListResearchs.
(-- api-linter: core::0158::response-next-page-token-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is irrelevant at this context --)

v2NoteState.description:
- NOTE_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: The NoteStatus has not been specified
 - NOTE_STATE_REGULAR: The note is a regular note
 - NOTE_STATE_DRAFT: The note is a draft note
 - NOTE_STATE_DELETED: The note is deleted
 - NOTE_STATE_INVALID: The note is auto deleted and marked as invalid
that deleted from Aladdin Research team either from index program or bulk load failure
v2NoteState.title: NoteState specifies the type of research note state (regular, draft, deleted)

v2ResearchNote.description: Research Note object is used in Research Note API server for persisting Research data.

id.description:
ID describes the computer or human assigned resource identifier.
The research note id.

author.description: The author of the research note.

creator.description: The creator of the research note.

subject.title:
The subject (title) of the research note.
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9027::dictionary-conflicting-types-existing=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we need to save subject of research note. --)

selectedPermissionGroups.title:
The selected permission groups.
(-- aip.dev/beta-blocker: refactor to use permission common resource when it's ready --)

entities.title:
The entities (e.g. securities, issuers, etc.) are associated with this research note
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we are using common Entity type. --)

customFields.title: This will contain custom fields which will have the name and its value which could be number, List, string or map

v2ResearchNoteQuery.description: ResearchNote Query describes different filter parameters that can be used to filter research notes.

filterCriteria.description:
Multiple criteria can also be joined by AND and OR logic operator
Other supported logic operator includes ! means not equal, IN for a list of value terms, etc.
e.g. note.author:"user" AND (note.entities.asset_id:"123456789" OR note.entities.issuer:"*ABC*") , etc.
Valid field name could be referered in the ResearchNote message type
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because user can pass multiple criteria to filter results. --)
filterCriteria.title:
Specifies the filter criteria, please refer to ResearchNote message for valid criteria target field name
The supported syntax (for now):
note.[target field]:[term] Eg: note.author:"user"
[term] Eg: Technology (Matches anything containing Technology anywhere)

orderBy.title: Sorts the response with ascending or descending order based on specific field. Default as asc. e.g. "note.publish_time desc, note.author"

facetFields.title:
Used to provide with facet search capabilities by simply specifiying the fields to be used as base
and by consequence, returned with an array for each of the specified fields and it's terms and
matches for each of the entries

fieldLists.description: When the field list is provided, only retrieve specified fields.

templateNames.description: When the template name list is provided, only retrieve specified templates.

OAuth2AccessCode.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the access code flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.

OAuth2ClientCredentials.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the client credentials flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.
